name: then
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A1 (at) that time (in the past or in the future): I was working in the city then.formal I wanted to live in the city, but my then husband (= the man who was my husband at that time) preferred the country. Give it to me next week - I won't have time to read it before/until then. I'll call you tomorrow - I should have the details by then.
More examplesFewer examplesHe's always harking back to his childhood and saying how things were better then.Just then, the lights went out.The train leaves at three minutes to eight, so we'd better get there a few minutes before then.If you come to the surgery at 10.30, the doctor will see you then.They used to live in a big house with lots of servants, but they've come down in the world since then.
